GOD.content: responsibility [via Potačka] must be guilt because responsibility is always unequal to itself: I will never be on the level of this infinite goodness > what gives my singularity, death & finitude, is what makes me unequal to the infinite goodness of the gift
GOD.linkedContent: responsibility [via Potačka] must be guilt because responsibility is always unequal to itself: I will never be on the level of this infinite goodness > what gives my singularity, death & finitude, is what makes me unequal to the infinite goodness of the gift

GOD.content: Heidegger doesn’t refer to infinite love to discuss primary guilt (Schuldigsein)
GOD.linkedContent: Heidegger doesn’t refer to infinite love to discuss primary guilt (Schuldigsein)

MONL.content: division, why one writes and how one dreams of writing: place of jealousy divided btwn vengeance and resentment.
MONL.linkedContent: division, why one writes and how one dreams of writing: place of jealousy divided btwn vengeance and resentment.

FK.content: “religion” involved in reacting antagonistically, re-affirmatively outbidding itself > in this place knowledge & faith bound to each other by band of their opposition
FK.linkedContent: “religion” involved in reacting antagonistically, re-affirmatively outbidding itself > in this place knowledge & faith bound to each other by band of their opposition

FK.content: Heidegger’s responsible-guilty-indebted (Shuldigsein) supposedly pre-moral, not Christian
one either responds to an address with absolute faith or reacts resentfully, impossible to tell which is the response, due to one contaminating the other
FK.linkedContent: one either responds to an address with absolute faith or reacts resentfully, impossible to tell which is the response, due to one contaminating the other

FK.content: reactivity of resentment opposes that which it hates in itself by excising it [auto-immunity]
FK.linkedContent: reactivity of resentment opposes that which it hates in itself by excising it [auto-immunity]

H.content: state techniques, like private spying & blackmail, threaten interiority of home, ipseity, integrity, cause purifying reactions, feeling of resentment [but???]
H.linkedContent: state techniques, like private spying & blackmail, threaten interiority of home, ipseity, integrity, cause purifying reactions, feeling of resentment [but???]

BL.content: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured
BL.linkedContent: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured

BL.content: dead father more powerful than living one
BL.linkedContent: dead father more powerful than living one

LOBL.content: is double affirmation same as Freud’s triumph? wouldn’t this risk negativity of mourning, economic resentment, melancholia in “yes, yes”? can this be avoided?
LOBL.linkedContent: is double affirmation same as Freud’s triumph? wouldn’t this risk negativity of mourning, economic resentment, melancholia in “yes, yes”? can this be avoided?

SPOM.content: reaction, reactionary, one interpretation of inheritance

POOF.content: “infinite abysses of imputability open on to mourning in the shadow of each and every event of death”
POOF.linkedContent: “infinite abysses of imputability open on to mourning in the shadow of each and every event of death”

SH.content: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself
SH.linkedContent: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself

F.content: any judicial thought of the Thing [chose, causa (also, “thing” in Old English means “assembly”)] also thinks that the trial (procès) should not have taken place, did not have place > not an acquittal, but that the space of acquittal should never have been constituted > trauma and “contradictory” incorporation should never have taken place
F.linkedContent: any judicial thought of the Thing [chose, causa (also, “thing” in Old English means “assembly”)] also thinks that the trial (procès) should not have taken place, did not have place > not an acquittal, but that the space of acquittal should never have been constituted > trauma and “contradictory” incorporation should never have taken place

F.content: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”
F.linkedContent: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”

FWT.content: deconstruction of DP makes untenable from w/in distinction btwn internal punishment (poena naturalis) & external (poena forensis): [Kant does Derrida’s work for him] since guilty should sign off on punishment, all executed punishment would be like a suicide > no law immune from interest, revenge, the sacrificial (for Kant, moral/judicial reason is sacrificial)
FWT.linkedContent: deconstruction of DP makes untenable from w/in distinction btwn internal punishment (poena naturalis) & external (poena forensis): [Kant does Derrida’s work for him] since guilty should sign off on punishment, all executed punishment would be like a suicide > no law immune from interest, revenge, the sacrificial (for Kant, moral/judicial reason is sacrificial)

P.content: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete

P.content: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente
P.linkedContent: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente

ATIA.content: Cain’s shame, like a second original sin, he needs to hide his nakedness, his crime, he feels excessively culpable > but, isn’t all wrongdoing excessive, le défaut devant le “il faut”
ATIA.linkedContent: Cain’s shame, like a second original sin, he needs to hide his nakedness, his crime, he feels excessively culpable > but, isn’t all wrongdoing excessive, le défaut devant le “il faut”

ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida thinks about the virtual guilt of the animal in relation to “hiding of oneself,” sexual coupling, modesty/shame

PS.content: man as the scato-theological being (this is the essence of guilt), capable of being soiled by the work and thieving God > God is a sin agains the unnameable Divine
PS.linkedContent: man as the scato-theological being (this is the essence of guilt), capable of being soiled by the work and thieving God > God is a sin agains the unnameable Divine

DPi.content: Baudelaire: “abolishers of the death penalty—very interested parties no doubt”
DPi.linkedContent: Baudelaire: “abolishers of the death penalty—very interested parties no doubt”

DPi.content: for Kant, DP inscribed in law (categorical imperative of penal law) in name of absolute, endless disinterestedness (is this a reactive moment of resentment?)
DPi.linkedContent: for Kant, DP inscribed in law (categorical imperative of penal law) in name of absolute, endless disinterestedness (is this a reactive moment of resentment?)

DPi.content: DP defenders & abolitionists: war of resentment?
vengeance/justice? kill for a reason—you are agent of DP; kill for no reason—not even guilty
DPi.linkedContent: vengeance/justice? kill for a reason—you are agent of DP; kill for no reason—not even guilty

TB.content: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately
TB.linkedContent: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately

PF.content: alibi—plea for defense, has meaning only where there’s accusation, guilt, thus responsibility (judicial or penal, but first of all ethical or political)
PF.linkedContent: alibi—plea for defense, has meaning only where there’s accusation, guilt, thus responsibility (judicial or penal, but first of all ethical or political)

PF.content: can there be a trace (and thus alibi) elsewhere than scene of culpa-responsi-bility, scene of debt, duty (Schuld, Schuldigsein)? an originary alibi that precedes juridico-ethico-political, but isn’t ontological neutrality?
PF.linkedContent: can there be a trace (and thus alibi) elsewhere than scene of culpa-responsi-bility, scene of debt, duty (Schuld, Schuldigsein)? an originary alibi that precedes juridico-ethico-political, but isn’t ontological neutrality?

PF.content: is the injunction to answer (answer to, answer for) inscribed right on the trace?
PF.linkedContent: is the injunction to answer (answer to, answer for) inscribed right on the trace?

PF.content: does law, morality, politics determine through & through the thinking of trace/alibi? no
PF.linkedContent: does law, morality, politics determine through & through the thinking of trace/alibi? no

PF.content: resistance can be praised for fighting dogma, denounced as reactive/frightened disavowal
PF.linkedContent: resistance can be praised for fighting dogma, denounced as reactive/frightened disavowal

PF.content: rhetoric of defense becomes rhetoric of accusation
PF.linkedContent: rhetoric of defense becomes rhetoric of accusation

TR.content: [re: “to swear”] délire names extraordinary coincidence of irrationality of machine (beyond my control) & absolute sincerity (authentic innocence of my intentions)
TR.linkedContent: [re: “to swear”] délire names extraordinary coincidence of irrationality of machine (beyond my control) & absolute sincerity (authentic innocence of my intentions)

TR.content: coincidence of infinite guilt & certainty in absolute, virgin, intact innocence> btwn infinite guilt & absence of guilty conscience
TR.linkedContent: coincidence of infinite guilt & certainty in absolute, virgin, intact innocence> btwn infinite guilt & absence of guilty conscience

TR.content: protest of accusatory innocence: forgive me this my virtue [ask forgiveness for feeling innocent]
TR.linkedContent: protest of accusatory innocence: forgive me this my virtue [ask forgiveness for feeling innocent]

TR.content: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty
TR.linkedContent: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty

TR.content: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable
TR.linkedContent: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable

TR.content: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)
TR.linkedContent: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)

TR.content: de Man: never enough guilt to match text-machine’s infinite power to excuse
TR.linkedContent: de Man: never enough guilt to match text-machine’s infinite power to excuse

TR.content: confession is always more and/or less guilty (for addressor & addressee) in act of its inscription than the fault being confessed: that confession is never innocent is a first machine, undeniable program
TR.linkedContent: confession is always more and/or less guilty (for addressor & addressee) in act of its inscription than the fault being confessed: that confession is never innocent is a first machine, undeniable program

WAP.linkedContent: re: coming “late” to think critically about teaching philosophy, Derrida explains he is not going to display histrionic guilt, as a matter of taste

PJP.content: university professors poisoned by the impotence of resentment [re: de Man Affair]
PJP.linkedContent: university professors poisoned by the impotence of resentment [re: de Man Affair]

PJP.content: anacoluthic catastrophe finds one of its privileged places in fold where the guilty accuses the witness, makes him bear responsibility for the offense
PJP.linkedContent: anacoluthic catastrophe finds one of its privileged places in fold where the guilty accuses the witness, makes him bear responsibility for the offense

EL.content: the vengeance of language (language as name of God) > a debt that leaves its signature in the language will be incurred by innocents, archiguilty, generations to come
EL.linkedContent: the vengeance of language (language as name of God) > a debt that leaves its signature in the language will be incurred by innocents, archiguilty, generations to come

HST.content: Levinas: ultimate proximity—to survive as a guilty one

LI.content: deniability in resentful attacks against deconstruction [de Man only a pretext], why is there so much fear, hate, denial of deconstruction? so much resentment?
LI.linkedContent: deniability in resentful attacks against deconstruction [de Man only a pretext], why is there so much fear, hate, denial of deconstruction? so much resentment?

LI.content: gesticulation of resentment always spectacular in its ignorance & cynicism
LI.linkedContent: gesticulation of resentment always spectacular in its ignorance & cynicism

TN.content: pray that you’ll outlive me, survivor guilt > the only reconciliation w/ death: not to see those I love die
TN.linkedContent: pray that you’ll outlive me, survivor guilt > the only reconciliation w/ death: not to see those I love die

BSi.content: [vis-à-vis Fontaine] that the sovereign’s [wolf’s] power (rage) is always an act of revenge, thus the beast [lamb] has originary guilt (ursprüngliche Schuldigsein): “si ce n’est toi, c’est donc ton frère”
BSi.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Fontaine] that the sovereign’s [wolf’s] power (rage) is always an act of revenge, thus the beast [lamb] has originary guilt (ursprüngliche Schuldigsein): “si ce n’est toi, c’est donc ton frère”

EU.content: classic situation: Descartes’ resentment toward Hardy [universal language] tells us more about Descartes than what he claims to be discussing
EU.linkedContent: classic situation: Descartes’ resentment toward Hardy [universal language] tells us more about Descartes than what he claims to be discussing

EU.content: Descartes jealously insists on adding “true philosophy” to Hardy’s universal language [he (Descartes) acts similarly w/ Augustine and St. Anselm?] > stakes must be serious wherever there’s violent defamation, never forget this
EU.linkedContent: Descartes jealously insists on adding “true philosophy” to Hardy’s universal language [he (Descartes) acts similarly w/ Augustine and St. Anselm?] > stakes must be serious wherever there’s violent defamation, never forget this

SPEC.content: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]
SPEC.linkedContent: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]

SPEC.content: if one’s [intellectual] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted & guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?
SPEC.linkedContent: if one’s [intellectual] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted & guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?

SPEC.content: Nietzsche dared to link debt to the unconscious, a debt to that which one feels in advance acquitted, the debt of another that comes back to torment you
SPEC.linkedContent: Nietzsche dared to link debt to the unconscious, a debt to that which one feels in advance acquitted, the debt of another that comes back to torment you

SPEC.content: [Derrida will link Nietzsche’s debt to Heidegger’s Schuldigsein elsewhere]

that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic
SPEC.linkedContent: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic

SPEC.content: “il s’envoie—et la poste fait suivre, elle ne donne ni ne demande jamais d’acquit définitif pour le solde du mandat” [sends himself w/out acquittance to meet the balance]
SPEC.linkedContent: “il s’envoie—et la poste fait suivre, elle ne donne ni ne demande jamais d’acquit définitif pour le solde du mandat” [sends himself w/out acquittance to meet the balance]
